in this review , we focus on the role of extracellular and intracellular reh in vitamin a metabolism .
furthermore , we will discuss the tissue specific function of reh and highlight major gap in the understanding of re catabolism .
this article be part of a special issue entitle retinoid and lipid metabolism .

mammal take up retinoid mostly from plant as pro-vitamin beta-carotene and from animal tissue as re .

accessibility and distribution of dietary re as well as the mobilization of intracellular re store require enzymatic activity from re hydrolase ( reh ) .
the accessibility of dietary re necessitate extracellular reh in the intestine .
after uptake in enterocyte , retinol be re-esterified to re and pack into nascent chylomicron ( cm ) together with other dietary lipid such as triacylglycerol ( tg ) .
in the circulation , these cm be deplete from lipid by lipoprotein lipase ( LPL ) mediated hydrolysis provide fatty acid ( fa ) and retinol for peripheral tissue .
in liver , re-rich cm remnant be mainly take up by hepatocyte .

yet , the vast majority of re be store in cytosolic ld of specialize liver cell , designate as hepatic stellate cell ( hsc ) , ito cell , or vitamin a storage cell .
these hepatic re store be mobilize by reh to ensure constant supply of peripheral tissue with retinol , also under condition where dietary retinoid be not available .
despite the pivotal role of vitamin a in many physiological process , surprisingly little be know about the enzyme and mechanism how re store be mobilize and how these process be regulate .
